title: expected and found types are the same with closure + lifetime + generics
body:
I tried this code:

```rs
fn apply_id<'a>(x: &'a ()) -> &'a () {
  apply(x, id)
}

fn id<'b>(x: &'b ()) -> &'b () {
  x
}

fn apply<T, F>(x: &(), f: F) -> T
where
  F: Fn(&()) -> T,
{
  f(x)
}
```

I expected to see this happen: a non-confusing diagnostic

Instead, this happened: a somewhat confusing diagnostic

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> src/lib.rs:2:5
   |
2  |     apply(x, id)
   |     ^^^^^ lifetime mismatch
   |
   = note: expected associated type `<for<'b> fn(&'b ()) -> &'b () {id} as FnOnce<(&(),)>>::Output`
              found associated type `<for<'b> fn(&'b ()) -> &'b () {id} as FnOnce<(&(),)>>::Output`
note: the required lifetime does not necessarily outlive the lifetime `'a` as defined on the function body at 1:13
  --> src/lib.rs:1:13
   |
1  | fn apply_id<'a>(x: &'a ()) -> &'a () {
   |             ^^
note: the lifetime requirement is introduced here
  --> src/lib.rs:11:19
   |
11 |     F: Fn(&()) -> T,
   |                   ^

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
```

Note that the expected and found associated type is the same.

### Meta

```
$ rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 59eed8a2aac0230a8b53e89d4e99d55912ba6b35
commit-date: 2021-11-01
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.56.1
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```
